entries.content: Suggest alternatives the prospect could pursue instead of your solution to make more money.
entries.notes: Part of the 'Compared to what?' strategy.

entries.content: Alternative suggestion: Why don't you just put your prices up?
Alternative suggestion: Why don't you just fire your worst salespeople?
Alternative suggestion: Why don't you just hire better salespeople?
Alternative suggestion: Have you considered coaching a senior executive from a competitor?
Alternative suggestion: Why not outsource your sales functions?
Ask the prospect to convince you why they are not going to do any of the suggested alternatives.
entries.notes: Forces them to articulate why other options fail.

entries.content: If they can't justify why alternatives won't work, there's no point in pursuing your solution.
entries.notes: Creates leverage and frames the value.

entries.content: The goal is to get the prospect to convince you they need what you have by eliminating alternatives.
Get the prospect to convince you they are going to spend the money you ask for.

focus_area: Handling Price Objections: Reframe to ROI, "Compared to what?", breakdown strategy
